article.description: Rhode Island opened a double-digit lead in the first six minutes and was never threatened in an 80-52 win over Boston University in the opening round of the NIT on Wednesday.
article.headline: Rams jump on Terriers early
article.linkText: Feeling Mello: Rhode Island rolls past BU
article.story:
SOUTH KINGSTOWN, R.I. (AP) -- Rhode Island opened a double-digit
lead in the first six minutes and was never threatened in an 80-52
win over Boston University in the opening round of the NIT on
Wednesday.

	   Steve Mello led Rhode Island with 13 points and Dawn Robinson
added 12.

	   Rashad Bell and Chaz Carr each had 14 points for Boston
University (20-6).

	   Rhode Island (20-13) opened the game by scoring the first nine
points, and led 17-4 with 12:16 to play in the first half. The Rams
led 43-20 at halftime.

	   Rhode Island surpassed the highest point total scored on Boston
University this season with 7:27 remaining as Mello hit a 3-pointer
for a 75-39 lead. BU came in ranked 12th in the nation with 58.8
points allowed per game.

	   The Terriers also struggled offensively in the first half,
missing all 13 of its 3-point attempts.

	   Boston University scored the first five points of the second
half, but a 15-2 Rhode Island run quickly put the game out of
reach.

	   Rhode Island will face West Virginia in the next round of the
NIT on Friday.
